author: Silvia Ascarelli
title: Surfing, skateboarding could become Olympic sports
text:
Five more sports could be added to the 2020 summer Olympic Games in Tokyo.
Organizers recommend adding surfing, skateboard, karate, sports climbing and baseball/softball to the program, which already has 28 sports.
A final decision will be made by the International Olympic Committee next August.
The recommendations come under a program that lets host cities propose additional sports for their Olympics. The IOC has said the sports should have strong youth appeal. Tokyo organizers made their choices from a list of eight finalists. The three that didn’t make the cut are squash, bowling and wushu, a form of Chinese martial arts.
Baseball, a popular sport in Japan, has already been an Olympic sport — from 1992 through 2008. The Japanese plan would have just six teams competing for medals. The same would be true for women’s softball, which was an Olympic sport from 1996 to 2008.
“Surfing embodies a cool, playful lifestyle that would add a completely new element to the program, helping the Games reach new fans through live action and stunning broadcast opportunities,” the International Surfing Association said in response to the news. The ISA sanctions events like the ISA World Surfing Games that were held in Nicaragua earlier this year.
Sports climbing is a version of rock climbing that uses permanent anchors in the rocks.
